newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Tadiran in $3.3 mln deal with Turkey.
newsitem.headline: Tadiran in $3.3 mln deal with Turkey.

text.p: Israel's Tadiran Ltd announced a $3.3 million deal to supply the Turkish air force with electronic equipment used to trace pilots who abandon their planes.
The deal for the Asars Airborne Search and Rescue Systems is Tadiran's first with Turkey and could pave the way for other contracts, the company said.
The system includes a device in the pilots uniform that transmits information about his whereabouts after he has abandoned his plane.
Tadiran, Israel's largest electronics company, said it had already signed similar deals with Italy and France. Tadiran, also traded in New York, is a subsidiary of Koor Industries.
